Description: Bone or ivory counter with a caricatured portrait, perhaps of the empress Livia: the subject has her hair dressed in a wide, flat 'nodus'. The hair is drawn back over the ear to form an elongated bun at the nape of the neck. The brow is furrowed, the nose strongly hooked, the lips thick, and the chin and neck angular. On the reverse is inscribed the numeral XII IB, and beneath, in Greek, (Λ)IB[IA], (L)IV[IA].
Bibliographic references: Walker & Higgs 2001 / Cleopatra of Egypt: from History to Myth (332)
